did.abstract: Prominent Quakers in several Long Island meetings joined in this petition to disavow any relationship with Thomas Case and his followers. Case was a radical Quaker preacher from Newtown, Queens County who proclaimed himself a second Christ. As a group, signers of this petition joined together to go on record as opposing and denying Case's blasphemy. Signers of the petition originated from areas of Long Island such as Gravesend, Flushing, Matinecock, and Newtown. The petition is dated 1675.
